Begin Row: Slip first stitch knitwise, wyib.  Then bring yarn to front between needles and slip next stitch knitwise, holding yarn in front*
Repeat: Then take yarn over right needle (yo) and around under needle to front again, as a yo is done before a purl stitch.  Then slip next stitch knitwise, holding yarn in front.  (no stitches are knitted on this row; all stitches are slipped knitwise, with the yarn weaving around the needle.)
End Row: After slipping the last stitch with the yarn held in front, make the same yo as before, taking the yarn over to the back and under to the front of the needle.  This last yo will be loose, and must be held on the needle while the work is turned.

Begin Row: Insert right needle purlwise down into the upside-down loop of the last, loose yo of the previous row (which passes under the needle to the back) *
Repeat: knit the yo together with the next stitch through back loops
End Row: last stitch will be without a yo. K-b the last stitch
